page.title: 17FARMING-TREWITHEN FARM
page.content: Trewithen Farm is sited S.E.E. from St.Merryn church.John May runs the farm,he is in a family partnership. {He owns}120 acres and{rents}100 acres. {John grows}96 acres of corn,20 acres of winter barley,13 acres of winter wheat and 63 acres of spring barley. There are 2 acres of rough grazing, 6 acres of woodland and the rest is good pasture. {The livestock}is mainly sheep altogether there are 2 Suffolk rams, 3 Dorset rams, 263 ewes and ewe lambs. John has 13 Steers <Friesian /Hereford crosses> and 5 Heifers. {John feeds}silage, cake, and stubble turnips. Animals are bought and sold at Truro, Wadebridge,and Liskard{markets. John has two modern{farm buildings. There are no non-family{employees.
